name: R5-SupplyRequestStatus-R4-SupplyRequestStatus
title: Concept map to convert a FHIR R5 SupplyRequestStatus into FHIR R4

element.display: The request is ready to be acted upon.

target.display: The request is ready to be acted upon.

element.display: The authorization/request to act has been terminated prior to the full completion of the intended actions.  No further activity should occur.

target.display: The authorization/request to act has been terminated prior to the full completion of the intended actions.  No further activity should occur.

element.display: Activity against the request has been sufficiently completed to the satisfaction of the requester.

target.display: Activity against the request has been sufficiently completed to the satisfaction of the requester.

element.display: The request has been created but is not yet complete or ready for action.

target.display: The request has been created but is not yet complete or ready for action.

element.display: This electronic record should never have existed, though it is possible that real-world decisions were based on it.  (If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "cancelled" rather than "entered-in-error".).

target.display: This electronic record should never have existed, though it is possible that real-world decisions were based on it.  (If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "cancelled" rather than "entered-in-error".).

element.display: The authorization/request to act has been temporarily withdrawn but is expected to resume in the future.

target.display: The authorization/request to act has been temporarily withdrawn but is expected to resume in the future.

element.display: The authoring/source system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this observation. Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, but the authoring/source system does not know which.

target.display: The authoring/source system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this observation. Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, but the authoring/source system does not know which.
